headline: Deckers (DECK) Q3 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: On the call is Stefano Caroti, President and Chief Executive Officer, and Steve Fasching, Chief Financial Officer.  Please note that certain statements made on this call are forward-looking statements within the meaning of the federal securities laws and are subject to considerable risks and uncertainties.  All statements made on this call today, other than statements of historical fact, are forward-looking statements and include statements regarding our ability to respond to the dynamic macroeconomic environment and the impacts on our business and operating results, including as a result of changes to global trade policy, tariffs, pricing actions, and mitigation strategies, and fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates.

headline: Deckers (DECK) Surpasses Q3 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Deckers (DECK) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +20.38% and +4.27%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Deckers (NYSE:DECK) Reports Strong Q4 CY2025, Stock Jumps 13.1%
summary: Footwear and apparel conglomerate Deckers (NYSE:DECK) reported Q4 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 7.1% year on year to $1.96 billion. The company’s full-year revenue guidance of $5.41 billion at the midpoint came in 0.9% above analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $3.33 per share was 20.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Deckers shares soar 15% as UGG and HOKA drive record Q3 earnings
summary: Investing.com -- Deckers Brands (NYSE: DECK) shares surged 15% after the footwear company reported third-quarter fiscal 2026 results that significantly exceeded analyst expectations, driven by strong demand for its UGG and HOKA brands.

raw.headline: Deckers shares soar 15% as UGG and HOKA drive record Q3 earnings

headline: Deckers Racks Up Record Revenue in Q3 as ‘Significant Global Demand’ for Ugg and Hoka Continues
summary: Net sales in Q3 increased 7.1 percent to $1.96 billion compared to $1.83 billion the same time last year.

raw.headline: Deckers Racks Up Record Revenue in Q3 as ‘Significant Global Demand’ for Ugg and Hoka Continues
raw.summary: Net sales in Q3 increased 7.1 percent to $1.96 billion compared to $1.83 billion the same time last year.

headline: Deckers Sales Rise on Demand for Hoka
summary: The footwear and apparel company says Hoka sales jumped 19%, while Ugg sales rose 4.9%. The company’s other brands saw sales decline 56%.

raw.headline: Deckers Sales Rise on Demand for Hoka
raw.summary: The footwear and apparel company says Hoka sales jumped 19%, while Ugg sales rose 4.9%. The company’s other brands saw sales decline 56%.

headline: Deckers: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Goleta, California-based company said it had profit of $3.33. The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of eight analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $2.77 per share.

raw.headline: Deckers: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
raw.summary: On a per-share basis, the Goleta, California-based company said it had profit of $3.33. The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of eight analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $2.77 per share.

headline: Deckers Brands Reports Third Quarter Fiscal Year 2026 Financial Results
summary: GOLETA, Calif., January 29, 2026--Deckers Brands (NYSE: DECK), a global leader in designing, marketing, and distributing innovative footwear, apparel, and accessories, today announced financial results for the third fiscal quarter ended December 31, 2025. The Company also provided an update to its financial outlook for the full fiscal year ending March 31, 2026.

raw.headline: Deckers Brands Reports Third Quarter Fiscal Year 2026 Financial Results

The Company also provided an update to its financial outlook for the full fiscal year ending March 31, 2026.

headline: Introducing the Cielo X1 3.0: A Propulsive Ride Built for Race Day
summary: GOLETA, Calif., January 29, 2026--HOKA®, a division of Deckers Brands (NYSE: DECK), introduces the Cielo X1 3.0, the brand’s lightest super shoe to date. Propulsive and precision-tuned for race day, the Cielo X1 3.0 is engineered to minimize weight and maximize performance, helping runners chase their fastest results yet.
